result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas B. Roeske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders bond on file to be applied. Costs are paid in full.

With Huber and Good Time Credit.
Concurrent with: 15CF164
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas B. Roeske

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 12:02 pm cases called. 15CF164 & 15CF168. Defendant Lucas B. Roeske in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record. Attorney Johnson confirms agreement. Statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 15CF164-Count 1- 6 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 25 days served. To begin no later than January 15, 2017. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 15CF164-Count 2-23 days WCJ with Huber and Good Time Credit. Concurrent to Count 1 & 15CF168. Credit for 25 days served.  Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 15CF168-7 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Concurrent to 15CF164. Credit for 25 days served. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Repayment of $539.80 extradition costs to be paid through bond posted. Court orders bond on file to be applied. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Johnson requests matter be set for sentencing in January.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 3, 2017 at 11:45 am.
Sentencing hearing on January 3, 2017 at 11:45 am.

10:48 am cases 15CF164 & 15CF168 called. Defendant Lucas B. Roeske in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Anderson makes statement regarding resolution on the record. State moves to Amend Count 1 on 15CF164 to Poss of THC-961.41(3g)(e) Misd. and Amend Count 1 in 16CF168 to Misd. Bail Jumping in violation of 946.49(1)(a) and Dismiss outright Repeater enhancer on Count 1 of 15CF164.   Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Arraignment addressed on all matters. Attorney Johnson confirms receipt of information on all matter and enters pleas.  Court accepts amendment of counts as stated by ADA Anderson.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 and 2 of 15CF164 & Count 1 of 15CF168. Court accepts plea and enters JOC and adjourns sentencing to January 2017. Court dismisses outright the Repeater enhancer on Count 1 of 15CF164. Court admonishes defendant regarding remaining on bond and effect of violation of bond upon the agreement reached.  Court sets matter for TSCN in December.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Plea hearing on September 13, 2016 at 10:45 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Hrg scheduled as requested.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on August 2, 2016 at 09:05 am.

BOND ORDERED AS TO BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS. 2015CF000164 and 2015CF000168.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant must maintain an active residence and employment address with the Clerk of Court's Office.   Employment address confirmed as Culver's, 2303 Sun Vista Drive, Lutz FL  33559.

15CF-164 and 15CF-168 - Both Cases Called @ 12:50 PM: Defendant Lucas B. Roeske in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In light of appearance, warrants withdrawn by the Court. Both Complaints Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing as to both matters.   Court finds probable cause as to both matters.  Def BOT.  15CF-164 -  INFO Filed - INFO Stated - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered as to both charges as to 15CF-164.  15CF-168 - INFO Filed - INFO Stated - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered as to 15CF-168.   DA argues as to nonmonetary bond conditions.  No objection by defense as to bond conditions.  Counsel confirm that matters are essentially resolved.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 09:05 am.
from DA Blader w/Memorandum and Invoice from Wisconsin Lock & Load Prisoner Transports LLC - Extradition Cancellation Charge of $539.80
Initial appearance on June 9, 2016 at 12:45 pm.
CASH BOND ORDERED AS TO BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS.  2015CF000164 AND 2015CF000168.

15CF164 and 15CF-168 - Both Cases Called @ 1:10 PM: Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses these matters upon request of defense counsel as to motion to quash the warrants and bond request.  Argument by Atty Johnson - argues for imposition of $5000 cash bond as per letter received 6/3/2016.  Argument by DA Blader - objects to the Court quashing warrants issued.  Def has been detained in the State of Florida since approx May 12th with delay in transport, Def is expected to arrive within the next few days from Lock & Load.  The Court:  Proposal will insure Def's presence and Court's jurisdiction.  Authorizes Cash Bond of $5000 as to both files - cash must be posted with either COC or WCSD; upon the posting of the cash bond the Court will direct vacature of the warrants and command that Def appear on June 9th when his counsel will be present in Waushara Co.  Should Def abide by terms and conditions of release on these warrants, the Court will allow his return to Florida to be present for the birth.  Def will be required to attend all future Court appearances as normally required, except for any future STC that counsel will appear telephonically for.  Atty Johnson confirms that resolution has already been negotiated and expects to recite on the record on June 9th.
